awd_titl_txt: I/UCRC for Environmental Waste Reduction and Prevention     through the Application of Flow Injection Analysis
awd_abstract_narration: 9319333  Kowalski    This supplement funds the University of Washington's  Industry/University Cooperative Research Center for Process  Analytical Chemistry.  The funding is provided by the Environmental  Protection Agency (EPA) to augment on-going research in the area of  sensor and flow injection monitoring for Environmental Waste  Reduction and Prevention at the Center.    This project entitled "Environmental Waste Reduction and Prevention  through the Application of Flow Injection Analysis" is to develop  solution handling techniques based on the developed Flow Injection  method as a replacement of standard methods of water analysis.   This project is a continuation of the project initially supported  by the EPA.    The Program Director recommends the University of Washington be  awarded $40,000 for one year with funds provided by EPA.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers
